text:
ALABAMA EDUCATIONAL TELEVISION COMMISSION
807 PROTECTIVE LIFE BUILDING
WAIQ, CHANNEL 2
COMMISSIONERS
BIRMINGHAM 3, ALABAMA
WBIQ. CHANNEL 10
TELEPHONE FAIRFAX 2-4625
WCIQ, CHANNEL 7
November 30, 1960
PROGRAM BOARD
Mr. William G. Harley
Suite 1119
DuPont Circle Office Building
1346 Connecticut Avenue, N. W.
Washington 6, D. C.
Dear Bill:
LOUIS PENEGUY
Director
Coordination a Information
Thanks for your letter of November 28 wherein you confirm the
date of April 22 for speaking to the Region 11 Conference.
Incidentally, this conference has been changed in its location
from Atlanta to Birmingham and arrangements are progressing
accordingly.
Thank you for changing my status with the Membership Com¬
mittee. I have enjoyed the assignment, and I am exceedingly
happy over the growth in membership during the time of my
chairmanship. If by serving on the committee I can be of
assistance to the new chairman, I will be agreeable to being
a member of the committee. If in your alignments you have
some responsibility that would involve international develop¬
ment, I believe I would enjoy such a new challenge.
Thank you for your interest in the possibility of my attending
some related educational meeting in the Far East during my
trip there next spring. Your assistance in this direction will
be most sincerely appreciated.
How are things progressing in Washington?
With kindest personal regards, I am
Raymond D. Hurlbert
General Manager
RDH/ml
The nation’s first educational television network with programs originated by University of Alabama, Auburn University, and Birmingham
Area Educational Television Association
